sn6.7:1.2: Now at that time the Buddha had gone into retreat for the day’s meditation.
sn6.7:1.3: Then the independent brahmās Subrahmā and Suddhāvāsa went to the Buddha and stationed themselves one by each door-post.
sn6.7:1.4: Then Subrahmā recited this verse about the mendicant Kokālika in the Buddha’s presence:
sn6.7:2.3: I think anyone who’d do such a thing
sn6.7:2.4: must be an ordinary person, wrapped in darkness.”
